articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: The Palestinian Islamic Jihad group fired a barrage of rockets into Israel on Monday, in an apparent show of force as Israeli tanks pressed their advance deeper into Gaza amid fierce fighting, residents and officials said.
articles.title: Gaza militants fire rockets into Israel, as tanks advance in north and south

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally (RN) party scored historic gains to win the first round of France's parliamentary election, but the final outcome will depend on days of alliance-building before next week's run-off vote.
articles.title: Historic win for far right in French first-round vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl barrelled across the Atlantic Ocean toward the Caribbean's Windward Islands as an "extremely dangerous" storm on Monday, threatening to devastate communities with floods, storm surges and life-threatening high winds, officials said.
articles.title: 'Extremely dangerous' Hurricane Beryl hurtles towards Caribbean

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A car hit pedestrians near Seoul city hall, killing six people and injuring at least eight, South Korea's Yonhap news agency reported, citing a police official, who said there could be more casualties.
articles.title: Car drives into crowd outside Seoul city hall, six dead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The leader of Russia's mainly Muslim Dagestan region where gunmen last month staged deadly attacks in two cities said on Monday that the security threat was coming from "international terrorist organisations".
articles.title: Leader of Russia's Dagestan blames attacks on 'international terrorists'

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Monday responded to criticism of President Joe Biden's performance in last week's debate, saying his policies over the past 3-1/2 years have boosted confidence in American leadership in the world.
articles.title: Blinken defends Biden, saying he restored global confidence in US leadership

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Peruvian presidential candidate Keiko Fujimori arrived in court on Monday at the start of a trial over allegations she received illegal funds from a Brazilian construction company and local firms, which could carry a jail penalty of up to 30 years.
articles.title: Peru's ex-presidential candidate Keiko Fujimori begins trial for money laundering

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: International envoys raised concerns about restrictions on women and girls in Afghanistan during meetings with the country's ruling Taliban in Qatar, United Nations' political affairs chief Rosemary DiCarlo said on Monday.
articles.title: Envoys voice concern over curbs on Afghan women in talks with Taliban

articles.author: Joan Faus, David Latona
articles.description: Spain's Supreme Court on Monday upheld arrest warrants for Catalonia's former leader and others charged with embezzlement over the region's failed secession bid, as it ruled that a recent amnesty law does not apply to them.
articles.title: Spain's top court upholds arrest warrants for Catalan separatists despite amnesty

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: More than 100 victims and relatives of victims of the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas militants in Israel sued Iran, Syria and North Korea on Monday, accusing the countries of providing Hamas support and demanding at least $4 billion in damages.
articles.title: Victims of Hamas attack sue Iran, Syria, North Korea in U.S. court
